title: How to Send Pictures in a Snapchat Conversation

steps.title: Open the Snapchat app.
steps.content: Open the Snapchat app. The Snapchat app resembles a white ghost icon on a yellow background. If you aren't logged into Snapchat, tap Log In and enter your username (or email address) and password.

steps.title: Swipe right on the camera screen.
steps.content: Swipe right on the camera screen. This action will take you to the "Chats" tab. Alternatively, tap the chat bubble icon to open the "Chats" tab.

steps.title: Tap a contact's name.
steps.content: Tap a contact's name. Doing this will open a chat window with that specific contact.

steps.title: Tap the camera icon.
steps.content: Tap the camera icon. It's to the left of the space where you would type your message to send a text chat . You may need to tap Allow to let Snapchat access your camera roll here.

steps.title: Tap the circle button at the bottom of the screen and take a snap like usual.
steps.content: Tap the circle button at the bottom of the screen and take a snap like usual. To switch cameras, tap the rectangle with arrows in the top right corner of your screen. The camera will capture what's on the screen and show it to you so you have the opportunity to edit it before sending it.

steps.title: Tap the icon of the paper airplane in the bottom right corner to send the captured image.
steps.content: Tap the icon of the paper airplane in the bottom right corner to send the captured image. Your Snap will be sent to your contact.

steps.title: Open the Snapchat app.
steps.content: Open the Snapchat app. The Snapchat app resembles a white ghost icon on a yellow background. If you aren't logged into Snapchat, tap Log In and enter your username (or email address) and password.

steps.title: Swipe right on the camera screen.
steps.content: Swipe right on the camera screen. This action will take you to the "Chats" tab. Alternatively, tap the chat bubble icon to open the "Chats" tab.

steps.title: Tap a contact's name.
steps.content: Tap a contact's name. Doing this will open a chat window with that specific contact.

steps.title: Tap the double-card icon.
steps.content: Tap the double-card icon. You'll see all the photos that are on your camera displayed at the bottom of your screen.

steps.title: Tap a picture to send.
steps.content: Tap a picture to send. You can tap one picture to send or tap to select multiple pictures. The tapped photos will display a blue checkmark in the center to indicate that they are selected and will send.

steps.title: Tap the send arrow.
steps.content: Tap the send arrow. It's in the bottom right corner of your screen. Doing so will send your photo to your selected contact.
